Post: It's time to introduce the guests of the first episode of IITTalks season 01. Nadia Nahar from BIT 3rd Batch, Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka. She is currently a lecturer of IIT, DU. And our very own Muksitul M Tanim Hasan from BIT 3rd Batch. He is currently working as a director of AL-BAQARAH AGRO PARK LTD. The first episode will go live on 16th July 2020 at 10 PM Bangladesh Time. #IITTalksS01e01 #IITSEC
The guest list of first episode WILL BE ANNOUNCED TONIGHT . Stay tuned! #IITTalks #IITSEC
Yes! Something very special is coming ... Stay tuned!  #IITTalks #IITSEC

TechCrunch 2.0: IT Awareness Workshop For Female College Students And Their Parents Organised by IITSEC, supported by ADB and in association with DUCSU. IIT Software Engineers' Community has successfully organized Tech Crunch 2.0 on 18th October, 2019 at TSC, University of Dhaka . This day long program had 4 sessions. A total of 77 students along with guardians participated in the whole program. the program was inagurated by Dr. Md. Akhtaruzzaman ,the Vice-Chancellor of the University of Dhaka. In this inaugural ceremony, special guests were 1. Dr. Md. Shariful Islam Director , Institute of Information and Technology, University of Dhaka 2. Ryotaro Hayashi Social Sector Specialist, South Asia Regional Department at Asian Development Bank 3. Professor Dr. Md. Mozahar Ali Higher Education Specialist (ADB- ICSETEP) 4. Md. Arif Ibne Ali ,Science & Technology Secretary DUCSU and 5. Md. Shayakh Shihab Uddin President, IIT Software Engineers' Community #iitsec #iitdu #techcrunch_2_0

MASTER IN INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY (MIT) Admission Notice, January - 2020 [22nd Batch] Key Features... ‚Ä¢ 36 Credits Hours ‚Ä¢ Flexibility of course enrollment per semester ‚Ä¢ 10 Courses + Project/Internship ‚Ä¢ State of the art class rooms and labs  ‚Ä¢ Courses on specialized tracks based on industry demand ‚Ä¢ Minimum duration 1 Year 6 Months Applications are invited from the prospective students desiring to take a program for the Master in Information Technology (MIT), to be offered by the Institute of Information Technology (IIT), University of Dhaka. Forty (40) students will be taken on the basis of merit

TechCrunch 2.0: IT Awareness Workshop For Female College Students And Their Parents Organised by IITSEC, supported by ADB and in association with DUCSU. Among the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDG), the 5th goal is Gender Equality. One of the targets to ensure Gender Equality is to enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular, information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women. If equal participation of male and female is not ensured, ...the gender gap created will increase the digital divide. As a result, we will face social and economic marginalization. To avoid this marginalization, women must be actively present at the IT sector. IIT Software Engineers' Community has successfully organized IlT Tech Crunch 2.0 on 18th October, 2019 at TSC, University of Dhaka . This day long program had 4 sessions. Session No-1:  Safe Internet for Girls  Speaker: Mahmuda Afroz Lucky ADC, Detective Branch, Dhaka Metropolitan  Session No-2:Unzipping Software Engineering and Campus tour (For Students) Speakers: 1. Dr. Zerina Begum Professor,Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka 2. Nadia Nahar Lecturer, Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka 3. Md. Saeed Siddik Assistant Professor, Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka Session No -2:  World of Tech (For Parents) Speakers: 1. Nasheeba Selim Senior Social Development and Gender Specialist, Bangladesh Resident Mission, Asian Development Bank 2.Dr. Naushin Nower Associate Professor , Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka Session No-4:  Ice Breaking Session Moderator: Dr. Kazi Muheymin-Us-Sakib Professor, Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka Speakers: 1. Professor Dr. Lafifa Jamal Professor, Department of Robotics and Mechatronics Engineering University of Dhaka. 2. Luna Shamsuddoha Founder and Chairman of  Dohatec New Media, Founder and President of Bangladesh Women in Technology (BWIT) 3.  Nadia Nahar Lecturer, Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka 4. Ishita Sur Apan Student , Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka A total of 77 students along with guardians participated in the whole program.  the program was inagurated by Dr. Md. Akhtaruzzaman ,the Vice-Chancellor of the University of Dhaka. In this inaugural ceremony, special guests were  1. Dr. Md. Shariful Islam  Director ,  Institute of Information and Technology,  University of Dhaka  2. Ryotaro Hayashi Social Sector Specialist,  South Asia    Regional Department at Asian Development Bank   3. Professor Dr. Md. Mozahar Ali Higher Education Specialist (ADB- ICSETEP)  4. Md. Arif Ibne Ali  ,Science & Technology Secretary DUCSU and  5. Md. Shayakh Shihab Uddin President,  IIT Software Engineers' Community       #iitsec #iitdu #techcrunch_2_0
TechCrunch 2.0 is organised by IITSEC, supported by ADB and in association with DUCSU.

So get ready for one of the most exciting  workshops in IT sector. Registration link -

IIT Software Engineers' Community has successfully organized a Seminar on "Are software engineers preparing for 4th Industrial revolution?"  on September 14th, 2019. Our respectable teacher Dr. Kazi Muheymin-Us-Sakib was the program chair of the seminar. The venue was Pharmacy Lecture Theatre Hall, Science Library, University of Dhaka. Students from different departments of different universities including University of Dhaka, who are interested to disruptive technologies and... trends such as the internet of things (IoT), robotics, virtual reality and artificial intelligence  registered to join the seminar. About 150 students were present on the venue to attend the seminar,  The speakers talked about the gap between  the software industry and academia. Not only that, a project showcasing ceremony was held in IIT at the end. We are really glad that a lot of interested people responsed and joined the seminar. Thanks to all. And we wish and hope that, more events are coming from IITSEC soon!

Ifter Program of IIT Family  2019, organised by IITSEC. We would like to thanks our director sir,  Dr. MD Shariful Islam  for his help and support.  Thanks everyone for joining this program and make a great evening.

Those who did not fill up the form yet, we urge you to fill it before the deadline (24 May) to let us know about your presence in Iftar Mahfil 2019. We will be happy if you join us at IIT on celebration of this holy month.  Link of form is given below: https://docs.google.com/‚Ä¶/1FAIpQLSeM5tGJeoFrmf5SC‚Ä¶/viewform‚Ä¶

IIT Software Engineers' Community has successfully organized INDEPENDENCE CUP-2019 on  April 04,  2019 at Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka premises. This day long program started with singing the national anthem followed by a programming contest and a quiz competition . A total of 27 teams participated in the programming contest. 40 contestants participated in the quiz competition . The winner of the INDEPENDENCE CUP 2019 Programming Contest is "Team C...ode Bots".  Top 3 teams of the programming contest- 1. Team Code Bots 2.Team Avro Coders 3. Team faltuHandlers "The Rising Star" award was given to "Team Gentlemen of IIT" for the best first year team in the Independence Cup- 2019 programming contest. Top 3 winners of quiz competition : 1. Yasin Sazid ( BSSE 10th batch)  2.Md. Rakib Trofder ( BSSE 11th batch) 3. Samiha Tahsin Noshin (BSSE 11th batch) Winners of various events of the ceremony was given away prizes at the end of the day by the Director and the respected teachers of Institute of Information Technology . Previous committee members came to the event  and inspired  the new committee members. Certificate  was given to them for their outstanding work for IITSEC by the director. The program ended with a charming photosession.

IT HR HUB Project meeting with stakeholders has successfully been held today at IIT premises. The two members of IITSEC were at the registration booth, other members  also participated in the meeting. Above all, IITSEC tried their best to make this event successful.

IIT  Software Engineers' Community has successfully organized IlT Tech Crunch'19  on 29th March, 2019 at Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka premises. This day long program had 5 sessions.  1. Basics of Programming  Mentor : Dr. Kazi Muheymin-Us-Sakib  Professor... Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka   2. World of Hacking  Mentor: Dr. B M Mainul Hossain Associate Professor Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka 3. Introduction to Artificial Intelligence  Mentor: Dr. Ahmedul Kabir Assistant Professor  Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka 4. Unzipping Software Engineering   Mentor :  Nadia Nahar Lecturer Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka 5. Quiz competition  A total of 30 students  participated in the whole program.Winners of the quiz competition were awarded prizes at the end of the day by the Director and the respected teachers of Institute of Information Technology. On prize giving ceremony, the director of IIT, Dr. Md Shariful Islam inspired the participants and said that he would help IITSEC every way possible to organize such events. The first-prize winner Sadia Alam muna said, " I like every session, find everything interesting.Today I have learnt many things, I will attend in every event organized by IIT in future and tell my friends to come. " The program ended with a charming photo session in front of IIT. #iitsec #iitdu #techcrunch_2019

Post: IIT Software Engineers' Community  has successfully organized INDEPENDENCE CUP 2018 on 31st March, 2018 at Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka premises. This day long program started with singing the national anthem followed by a programming contest, a quiz competition and a extemporaneous speech competition. A total of 26 teams participated in the programming contest. 48 contestants participated in the quiz competition and 13 contestants participated in the extemporaneous speech competition. The winner of the INDEPENDENCE CUP 2018  Programming Contest is "Team Retribution Redefined". Winners of various events of the ceremony was given away prizes at the end of the day by the Director and the respected teachers of  Institute of Information Technology . The program ended with a mesmerizing cultural event.

Tanvir Ahassan Anik.reply_text: Well done boy. Keep up the good work :D

Post: "Tech for Peace" is an initiative to develop a network of youth to work against violence! The network members will be taken through a journey where they will be able to build digital solutions to solve problems that hinders to make a peaceful society. As a part of the initiative, bootcamps, hackdays, gala pitching and 3 months incubation will be organized in collaboration with Institute of Information Technology, University of Dhaka and IIT Software Engineer's Community.  The... bootcamp will provide overall information about T4P Digital Challenge and speakers will train you to build a tech product to solve most pressing violent issues of recent times. For more information please visit: https://peace.digital/  and www.facebook.com/peace.digital/
